marketNews.title: Minor IHSG Evaluation: AMMN Weight Increases, BBRI Decreases
marketNews.content: On 24 September 2024 the Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced the results of a minor evaluation of the IHSG index for the effective period 1 October to 31 December 2024. The evaluation includes changes in the weight of several stocks in the index, with Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN) experiencing the most significant increase of +1.41 percentage points to reach a weight of 5.42%. On the other hand, Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) suffered the largest decrease of -0.96 percentage points, bringing its weight down to 9.00%. To determine a stock's weight in the IHSG, BEI uses a free‑float adjusted index and applies a maximum cap of 9%. In the previous evaluation in June 2024, BBRI's weight rose from 6.75% to 9%. However, the share price increase of BBRI over the past three months caused its weight to rise to 9.96% before the September 2024 evaluation. The weight reduction for BBRI in the September evaluation was driven by the application of the 9% cap. Previously, the free‑float share count for BBRI used in the June evaluation was 60 billion shares, which corresponded to the 9% cap at that time. In the September evaluation the free‑float share count fell to 54.6 billion shares, reaching the 9% cap. Besides AMMN, the issuers with the largest weight increases in the September 2024 evaluation were AMRT (+0.20 percentage points) and BNLI (+0.12 percentage points). The issuers with the largest weight decreases after BBRI were BMRI (-0.10 percentage points) and TLKM (-0.06 percentage points). The next IHSG index evaluation will be carried out in December 2024, covering the effective period 1 January to 31 March 2024. Key Takeaway: This re‑weighting can affect investors, especially institutional investors who use the IHSG as a benchmark or passive index‑tracking funds. Since the announcement of the new index weighting on 24 September 2024, BBRI's share price has fallen about -9% as of 26 September 2024, with foreign outflows reaching 4.1 trillion rupiah. Note that some of BBRI's free‑float shares have not yet been accounted for in the IHSG weighting. Therefore, if BBRI's weight declines further due to price drops, the weighting could rise again.

marketNews.title: China Considers Injecting Up to $142 Billion into Major State‑Owned Banks
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Chinese government is considering injecting capital of up to 1 trillion yuan, equivalent to about 142 billion US dollars, into several of its largest state‑owned banks. The move aims to boost the banks' capacity to support China's struggling economy. According to Bloomberg sources, the funding would mainly come from a new special sovereign bond issuance, although details are still being finalized and may change. If implemented, this would be the first time since the global financial crisis of 2008 that the Chinese government directly injects capital into its major banks.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Energy Ministry Reviews Copper Concentrate Export Permit
marketNews.content: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said the government is reviewing a plan to reopen copper concentrate export permits for companies that have completed smelter construction. Bahlil noted that the discussion considers that some smelters, although built, are not yet fully operational. The statement came a few days after PT Freeport Indonesia and Amman Mineral Internasional (AMMN) inaugurated their respective copper smelters on Monday, 22 September. Previously, the government had banned concentrate exports starting 1 June 2024, but allowed a grace period until 31 December 2024 for companies with smelters more than 50% complete.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Energy Ministry Reviews Green Power Export Plans
marketNews.content: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said the ministry is re‑examining the plan to export green electricity, taking national interest into account. Previously, Indonesia signed a memorandum of understanding to export low‑carbon electricity amounting to 3.4 GW to Singapore, to be supplied by five companies: Pacific Medco Solar Energy Power with Consortium Partners, Adaro Green, PacificLight Power Pte. Ltd., Gallant Venture Ltd., Salim Group, and TBS Energi Utama (TOBA).

marketNews.title: IKN Budget from APBN Reaches 96.13 Trillion Rupiah (2022‑2025)
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the budget for the new capital city (IKN) from the State Budget (APBN) amounts to 96.13 trillion rupiah for the 2022‑2025 period, exceeding the initial allocation where the government had planned to use only 20% of the total IKN budget, about 93.2 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Jakarta Central Court Places Four Bakrie Group Companies under Debt Restructuring (PKPU)
marketNews.content: The Central Jakarta District Court ruled that four companies owned by the Bakrie family—PT Lativi Mediakarya, Intermedia Capital (MDIA), Visi Media Asia (VIVA), and PT Cakrawala Andalas Televisi—are in a suspension of debt payment status (PKPU). According to the creditor's attorney, Marx Andryan, the court gave a 45‑day deadline for the companies to settle their total debt of 8.79 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: DOID Secures Extension of A$200 Million Per Year Coal Mining Contract
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur (DOID) through its subsidiary BUMA Australia Pty. Ltd. obtained an extension of its coal mining contract with TEC Coal Pty. Ltd. for the Meandu Mine in Queensland, Australia. The extension will run until June 2026 with a value of approximately 200 million Australian dollars per year. Under the new contract, BUMA Australia will maintain its current operational scale, producing about 35 million bcm annually and handling roughly 7 million tonnes of coal.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Reports Strong August 2024 Heavy‑Equipment Sales and Coal Production
tickerNews.content: United Tractors (UNTR) recorded sales of 435 Komatsu heavy‑equipment units in August 2024, a month‑over‑month increase of 18.2% and a year‑over‑year rise of 8.8%. Cumulatively for the first eight months of 2024, Komatsu sales reached 2,950 units, down 25.3% YoY, representing 65.6% of the revised 2024 target of 4,500 units. The market share stood at 28% (versus 28% in 7M24 and 31% in 8M23). In the mining contractor segment, UNTR produced 98 million tonnes of coal in 8M24, up 16.9% YoY, with overburden removal of 809.5 million bcm, a 9% YoY increase.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Anticipates Positive Impact from Coal Compensation Scheme (MIP)
tickerNews.content: Bukit Asam's (PTBA) corporate secretary, Niko Chandra, said the company hopes that regulations concerning the coal compensation fund scheme through the Managing Institution Partner (MIP) will be issued soon and positively affect the company's financial performance. Previously, PTBA's director, Farida Thamrin, indicated that higher margins could be achieved if the price spread between the Coal Reference Price (HBA) and domestic coal sales widens under the MIP. According to the Director General of Mineral and Coal, Tri Winarno, the implementation is awaiting approval from one more ministry or agency.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Advances Geothermal Exploration in Way Ratai, Lampung
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO), through its joint venture with Chevron New Energies Holdings Indonesia Ltd. and PT Cahaya Anagata Energy, began an exploration survey in the Way Ratai geothermal work area (WKP) in Lampung, committing US$28.85 million to the project. The potential geothermal power plant capacity in the area is estimated at 105 MW, with commercial operation targeted for 2032. PT Cahaya Anagata Energy is expected to negotiate a power purchase agreement with PLN at a tariff of 7.59 to 9.87 Indonesian cents per kWh.

tickerNews.title: AALI Announces Interim Dividend of Approximately 161.7 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Astra Agro Lestari (AALI) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to roughly 161.7 billion rupiah, or 84 rupiah per share. The dividend will be recorded in the regular and negotiated markets on 3 October 2024, with payment scheduled for 24 October 2024. Based on AALI's share price on Thursday, 26 September, at 6,775 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is about 1.2%.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Approves 1:4 Stock Split Effective 14 October 2024
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Indosat (ISAT) approved a stock split with a ratio of 1:4 in a general meeting of shareholders (RUPSLB). Trading of the shares with the new nominal value will become effective on 14 October 2024.

tickerNews.title: LABA Plans Formation of Four Battery‑Related Subsidiaries with 37.5 Billion Rupiah Investment
tickerNews.content: Green Power Group (LABA) announced plans to establish four subsidiaries in the electric vehicle battery sector, with a total investment of approximately 37.5 billion rupiah. The subsidiaries will focus on digital battery management system (BMS) technology, manufacturing of component parts and molds, battery swapping networks, and import/export of renewable energy products. LABA will partner with companies from Hong Kong and Zhejiang, China, to set up these entities.

tickerNews.title: OASA Founder Sells 126.9 Million Shares for Approximately 19.9 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Maharaksa Biru Energi's President Director, Gafur Sulistyo Umar, sold 126.9 million shares of OASA at a price of 157 rupiah per share, totaling roughly 19.9 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Gafur Sulistyo Umar's ownership in OASA decreased from 50.64% to 48.64%.

tickerNews.title: TMPO Secures Convertible Loan of 10 Billion Rupiah from Pramana Media Investama
tickerNews.content: Tempo Inti Media's (TMPO) subsidiary, PT Info Media Digital, obtained a convertible loan of 10 billion rupiah from PT Pramana Media Investama. The loan has a term of 24 months with an interest rate not exceeding 8.8%. The loan term can be extended for another 24 months or converted at the request of PT Pramana Media Investama.

tickerNews.title: AMAN Founder Purchases Approximately 9.4 Million Shares at Average 112 Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Johan Tedja Surya, controlling shareholder and chief commissioner of Makmur Berkah Amanda (AMAN), bought about 9.4 million AMAN shares at an average price of 112 rupiah per share on 20 September 2024. The transaction value was roughly 1.1 billion rupiah. After the purchase, his ownership increased from 1.61% to 1.85%.
